ThingDef.Description: A book that was written by an author known as Parallel_Parkour.

BookText.li: Why dont I eat black jelly beans?
I just haven't liked them,
Ever since the accident.
Not since the accident.
I will tell you.
Once upon a time,
In a far away land,
There lived a small child,
By the name of Parallel_Parkour.
He loved jelly beans,
Even the black ones,
But everything changed when the Fire Nation attacked.
Take care, young ladies, and value your wine.
Be watchful of young men in their velvet prime.
Deeply they'll swallow from your finest kegs,
Then swiftly be gone, leaving bitter dregs.
Ahh-ah-ah-ah, bitter dregs.
With smiling words and tender touch,
Man offers little and asks for so much
He loves in the breathless excitement of night,
Then leaves with your treasure in cold morning light.
Ahh-ah-ah-ah, in cold morning light.
Ahh-ah-ah-ah, in cold morning light.
Ahh-ah-ah-ah, in cold morning light.

ThingDef.label: It Was a Dark and Stormy Night

BookText.li: It was a dark and stormy night.
Suddenly, a shot rang out!
A door slammed.
The maid screamed.
Suddenly, a pirate ship appeared on the horizon!
While millions of people were starving, the king lived in luxury.
Meanwhile on a small farm in Kansas, a boy was growing up.
A light snow was falling...
The little girl with the tattered shawl had not sold a violet all day.
At that very moment...
A young intern at the City Hospital was making an important discovery.
The mysterious patient in Room 213 had finally awakened.
She moaned softly.
Could it be that she was the sister of the boy in Kansas,
Who loved the girl with the tattered shawl,
Who was the daughter of the maid who had escaped from the pirates?
The intern frowned.

ThingDef.label: Ancient Wisdom
ThingDef.Description: A book full of ancient chinese wisdom quotes.

BookText.li: A person who says 'it cannot be done',
Should not interrupt the man doing it.
Be not afraid of growing slowly,
Be afraid only of standing still.
Seeing it once is better than being told 100 times.
He who asks is a fool for five minutes,
But he who does not ask remains a fool forever.
A journey of a thousand miles,
Must begin with a single step.
The man who carried away pebbles,
Was the man who moved the mountain.
A wise man makes his own decisions,
An ignorant man follows public opinion.
If you are patient in one moment of anger,
You escape a hundred days of sorrow.
Life is really simple but we insist,
On making it complicated.
What you do not wish upon yourself,
Extend not to others.
Tell me and I will forget,
Show me and I may remember,
Involve me and I'll understand.
Failure is not falling down,
But refusing to get up.
If you love something, set it free.
If it comes back to you, it is yours.
If it doesn't, it never was.

ThingDef.label: Three Little Boars

BookText.li: Once upon a time,
There lived three little boars,
And a hungry centipede.
The centipede wanted to eat the boars,
But the boars built a home made of granite blocks.
The centipede's inferno cannon was no match at all,

ThingDef.label: Mad Boomrat
ThingDef.Description: This book is based on real events. It is written by Elerd.

BookText.li: It was the third day of a long and painful siege,
James and Rookie were dead and buried, and I had my right ear blown off.
David, our sniper, decided to take it upon himself to free us from this nightmare.
As he stealthly sneaked about the grass, looking for the raiders' base,
He suddenly whispered urgently at the comms.
With my one ear I could make out that one distress signal we never wanted to hear;
"MAD BOOMRAT!"
A loud bang sounded far off.
With my pistol in hand and the comms eerily silent, I opened the colony door.
The entire field was on fire.
Looking far away, I saw the fire slowly crawling towards the raiders' base.
As the fires reached their cannons, two horrible explosions burned at my eyes.
I was never as happy to feel the rain pour, as it did that night.
I never did find David's body,
But as soon as I could, I built a statue in his honor.
